Year: - Total_Exports_USD_B: Total merchandise exports (FOB) in billions USD
- FDI_Exports_USD_B: Exports by foreign-invested enterprises (FDI sector)
- FDI_Export_Pct: % of total exports from FDI sector
- Domestic_Exports_USD_B: Exports by domestic enterprises (state-owned + private Vietnamese)
- Domestic_Export_Pct: % of total exports from domestic sector
- FDI_Export_Growth_Pct: Year-over-year growth rate of FDI exports
- Total_Imports_USD_B: Total merchandise imports (CIF) in billions USD
- FDI_Import_Pct: % of total imports by FDI sector
- Domestic_Import_Pct: % of total imports by domestic sector
- Domestic_Export_Growth_Pct: Year-over-year growth rate of domestic exports
- Trade_Balance_USD_B: Total exports minus total imports
- FDI_Sector_Balance_USD_B: FDI exports minus FDI imports (FDI trade balance)
- Domestic_Sector_Balance_USD_B: Domestic exports minus domestic imports (domestic trade balance)
- FX_Reserves_USD_B: Total international reserves in billions USD
- Reserves_Months_Imports: FX reserves in months of imports
- GDP_USD_B: Gross Domestic Product in billions USD
- 1995-2005: Estimated from Harvard Ash Center research (Perkins et al.)
- FDI sector defined as: Foreign-invested enterprises registered under Vietnam FDI Law
- Domestic sector: All Vietnamese-owned enterprises (SOEs + private Vietnamese firms)
- Growth rates calculated as: (Current Year - Previous Year) / Previous Year × 100
- 2025: 77.3% of exports (PEAK but slight decline from 79%)
→ Domestic sector fell from 72.5% → 22.7% (70% decline in relative share!)
* Mostly parts & components for export assembly
→ Heavy reliance on FDI for trade surplus
- BUT FDI growth slowing: +22.6% (2025) vs +31.9% (2024) imports
→ Import dependency on China (40.9% of imports)
→ Vietnam MOST dependent on FDI in exports!
✅ FDI sector highly productive ($/worker: FDI 2x higher)
✅ Global value chain integration strong (80% of tech exports)
✅ Employment: ~3.5M FDI jobs (35% of formal workforce)
❌ Thin profit margins (imported inputs 60-70% of value)
❌ Vulnerable to FDI reallocation (U.S. tariff risk)
2. Supply chain localization: Require 30% local inputs
4. Target: Raise domestic export share from 22.7% → 25% by 2026
1. Move up value chain: High-tech components
2. Develop local suppliers: Link FDI with domestic SMEs
3. Promote domestic brands: Support Vietnamese companies
4. Reduce import reliance: Build local supply alternatives
5. Target: Raise domestic export share to 30% by 2030
2. Education/reskilling: Prepare workforce for high-skill jobs
- Domestic exports contracted -6.1% in 2025 (first major decline!)
- This signals weakening competitiveness of Vietnamese firms
- FDI carrying all export growth (77.3% share)
- If FDI slows/relocates → export collapse risk
